intro: Amsinckia jonesii, commonly known as Jones' fiddleneck, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive, narrow corolla. Amsinckia jonesii is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
